qas.question: What is a large domain of prokaryotic microorganisms?
What configurations can bacteria can bacteria take?
When is the typical lenght  for bacteria?

answers.text: present in most of its habitats

qas.question: What is the relationships between plants animals and bacteria?

context: <a0_0>Bacteria<a0_0/> (i/bækˈtɪəriə/; singular: bacterium) constitute a large domain of prokaryotic microorganisms. Typically a <a2_0>few micrometres<a2_0/> in length, bacteria have a number of shapes, ranging from <a1_0>spheres to rods and spirals<a1_0/>. Bacteria were among the first life forms to appear on Earth, and are <a3_0>present in most of its habitats<a3_0/>. Bacteria inhabit soil, water, acidic hot springs, radioactive waste, and the deep portions of Earth's crust. Bacteria also live in <a4_0>symbiotic and parasitic relationships<a4_0/> with plants and animals. They are also known to have flourished in manned spacecraft.
